section.section: The treasurer of a campaign finance entity shall keep a detailed and accurate account book of all assets received, expenditures made, and obligations incurred by or on behalf of the entity.

To the extent practicable, the treasurer of a campaign finance entity shall record the occupation and employer of an individual who makes contributions to the campaign finance entity in a cumulative amount of $500 or more during an election cycle.
Each expenditure made from a campaign account shall be supported by a receipt.

text.section:
The account books and related records of a campaign finance entity shall be preserved until the earlier of:
10 years after the creation of an account book entry or related record; or
2 years after the campaign finance entity files a final campaign finance report under Subtitle 3 of this title.
